com.codingame.gameengine.core

Class AbstractPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codingame.gameengine.core.AbstractPlayer

  • public abstract class AbstractPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    The representation of the a player's AI during the game's execution.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractPlayer.TimeoutException
      An Exception thrown by getOutputs() when the player's AI did not respond in time after an execute().

      AbstractPlayer()

      Returns a string that will be converted into the real avatar by the viewer, if it exists.

      Returns an integer that will be converted into the player's real color by the viewer.

      Returns the number of lines that the player must return.

        Returns an integer that will be converted into the player's real color by the viewer.
        Returns:

      • getAvatarToken

        public final java.lang.String getAvatarToken()
        Returns a string that will be converted into the real avatar by the viewer, if it exists.
        Returns:
        the player's avatar token.

      • isActive

        public final boolean isActive()
        Returns true is the player is still active in the game (can be executed).
        Returns:
        true is the player is active.

      • getIndex

        Get player index from 0 (included) to number of players (excluded).

        public final int getScore()
        Get current score.
        Returns:

      • setScore

        public final void setScore(int score)
        Set current score. This is used to rank the players at the end of the game.
        Parameters:
        score -

      • deactivate

        public final void deactivate()
        Deactivate a player. The player can't play after this and is no longer in the list of active players.

      • deactivate

        public final void deactivate(java.lang.String reason)
        Deactivate a player and adds a tooltip with the reason. The player can't play after this and is no longer in the list of active players.
        Parameters:
        reason - Message to display in the tooltip.

      • sendInputLine

        public final void sendInputLine(java.lang.String line)
        Adds a new line to the input to send to the player on execute.
        Parameters:
        line - The input to send.

      • execute

        public final void execute()
        Executes the player for a maximum of turnMaxTime milliseconds and store the output.

      • getOutputs

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOutputs()
                                                  throws AbstractPlayer.TimeoutException
        Gets the output obtained after an execution.
        Returns:
        a list of output lines
        Throws:
        AbstractPlayer.TimeoutException

      • getExpectedOutputLines

        public abstract int getExpectedOutputLines()
        Returns the number of lines that the player must return. If the player do not write that amount of lines before the timeout delay, no outputs at all will be available for this player. The game engine will not read more than the expected output lines. Extra lines will be available for next turn.
        Returns:
        the expected amount of lines the player must output
